noun.description: A member of an Oscan-Umbrian people living in the area around Teate (now Chieti) in ancient Italy.
The Oscan-Umbrian language of the Marrucinians.

adjective.description: Of or relating to the Marrucinians or their language.

origin: Mid 19th century; earliest use found in William Purdie Dickson (1823–1901), theologian and translator. From classical Latin Marrūcīnī, plural + -an.
